newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post page one - Sept 4.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post page one - Sept 4.

text.p: The Washington Post carried the following stories on its front page on September 4:

WASHINGTON - The United States moved to further weaken Iraqi President Saddam Hussein's control of his own airspace, significantly enlarging the southern no-fly zone after firing 27 cruise missiles at Iraq's air defences.
WASHINGTON - The Clinton Administration issued surprisingly vague justifications for its cruise missile attack on Iraq.

WASHINGTON - Maryland Governor Parris Glendening fires back at critics, saying business executives had organised a meeting to discuss his job performance out of pique over his refusal to to grant them millions of dollars in state favours.
WASHINGTON - D.C.'s first day of school is orderly but stressful with classes starting late at some alternative sites.
MIAMI - The managers who monitor the health of the Everglades have reported some good news - the water is cleaner.
